official-title.#text: To reauthorize and restructure the adoption incentives grant program, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives October 22, 2013.

term.#tail: means, with respect to a State, the exit of a child from foster care under the responsibility of the State to live with a legal guardian, if the State has reported to the

text.#text: The term
that the State agency has determined that—

the child has been removed from his or her home pursuant to a voluntary placement agreement or as a result of a judicial determination to the effect that continuation in the home would be contrary to the welfare of the child;
being returned home or adopted are not appropriate permanency options for the child;
the child demonstrates a strong attachment to the prospective legal guardian, and the prospective legal guardian has a strong commitment to caring permanently for the child; and
if the child has attained 14 years of age, the child has been consulted regarding the legal guardianship arrangement; or
the alternative procedures used by the State to determine that legal guardianship is the appropriate option for the child.

short-title.#text: Promoting Adoption and Legal Guardianship for Children in Foster Care Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 101. Extension of program through fiscal year 2016.
Sec. 104. Limitation on use of incentive payments.
Sec. 105. Increase in period for which incentive payments are available for expenditure.

Sec. 106. State report on calculation and use of savings resulting from the phase-out of eligibility requirements for adoption assistance; requirement to spend 20 percent of savings on post-adoption services.
Sec. 107. Preservation of eligibility for kinship guardianship assistance payments with a successor guardian.
Title II—Extension of family connection grant program
Sec. 201. Extension of family connection grant program.
Sec. 301. Improving the collection of unemployment insurance overpayments through tax refund offset.
